qas.question: What dictates that a receipt for expenditures of all public money must be published?
Which section specifically states that receipts for public money must be published?
Which currency are the sums of money in the "Statements" displayed in?
What is the unit of account of the United States?
What dictates that a receipt for expenditures of all public codes must be published?
Which section specifically states that receipts for provisions must be published?
In which currency are the sums of provisions in the "Statements" displayed in?
What is the unit of report provisions of the United States?

plausible_answers.text: a regular Statement and Account of the Receipts and Expenditures of all public Money

context: <a0_0><b4_0>The Constitution<b4_0/><a0_0/> provides that "<b8_0>a regular Statement and Account of the Receipts and Expenditures of all public Money<b8_0/> shall be published from time to time". That provision of the Constitution is made specific by <a1_0><b5_0>Section 331<b5_0/><a1_0/> of Title 31 of the United States Code. The sums of money reported in the "Statements" are currently being expressed in <a2_0><b6_0>U.S. dollars<b6_0/><a2_0/> (for example, see the 2009 Financial Report of the United States Government). The <a3_0><b7_0>U.S. dollar<b7_0/><a3_0/> may therefore be described as the unit of account of the United States.
